description: Borrowed from Latin dēspērātus, past participle of dēspērō (“to be without hope”).

adjectives.description: desperate (comparative more desperate, superlative most desperate)

entries.meaning: In dire need (of something); having a dire need or desire.
examples: I hadn't eaten in two days and was desperate for food.
desperate to eat; desperate for attention

entries.meaning: Being filled with, or in a state of, despair; hopeless.
examples: I was so desperate at one point, I even went to see a loan shark.

entries.meaning: Beyond hope, leaving little reason for hope; causing despair; extremely perilous.
Involving or employing extreme measures, without regard to danger or safety; reckless due to hopelessness.
examples: He dove into the rushing waters in a desperate effort to save her life.
Whoever's writing the stuff on this has desperate handwriting, like they must be a doctor...

entries.meaning: A person in desperate circumstances or who is at the point of desperation, such as a down-and-outer, addict, etc.
